column4: Could someone help me getting Evolution Mail set up to send mail?
sure
what error are you getting?
can you send or recieve right now , or neither?
your mail address is someone@somewhere.com , whats the somewhere.com bit?
That would be colgate.edu
i just lookup up the domain and it returned mailmx.colgate.edu, smtp is probably the same machine, try smtp first though
try sending a mail now , you can send to me if you want , sean@odonnell.nu
I've tried that before, but I'm trying it again now...
if that does not work , try checking the 'Server requires authentication' box and filling in your username at the bottom
you can also try the username with and without the domain , and try the various different types of authentication
also if it gives an error message let me know what it is
I've run a few mail severs so we should be able to figure it out
just telneted to mail.colgate.edu on port 25, its definately a working smtp server
if you go into tools accounts on that machine , you can check the send mail settings there
Right, that computer uses sendmail.
dont know enough about sendmail to know how to extract the servername
Would there be a configuration file somewhere?
this is probably going to be one for the colgate admins unfortunately
the sendmail config file is going to be called something.mc
at the end of the file there will be a MAILER entry, that should contain the smtp server details and settings
